algorithm-bias.title: Technical solutions to tackle AI bias
algorithm-bias.description: Yes, we want more diverse workplaces but there are things on the computing side companies and developers can do to make AIs fairer.

candy-machine-mint-and-reveal.title: How to mint and reveal NFTs with Candy Machine V2
candy-machine-mint-and-reveal.description: In this tutorial, you'll learn how to create a “mint and wait for reveal” Candy Machine. Doing so will allow Candy Machine users to mint “closed” NFTs and wait for them to be “revealed” at a later date, bringing elements of anticipation and excitement to their experience.

author.name: Kevin Guevara and Juan Diego García
author.title: Monadical

export-phantom-wallet.title: How to import your wallet to Solana CLI
export-phantom-wallet.description: Whether you’re looking to backup your wallet or deliver NFTs,  importing your wallet is a great trick to have up your sleeve.

why-systems-software-why-rust.title: The Rust Journey, Part 0: Why Systems Software and Why Rust?
why-systems-software-why-rust.description: Part 0 in our series about learning and writing systems software using Rust.

operator-overloading-in-python.description: What is operator overloading and how does it work in Python?

plot-mathematical-functions-in-python.description: How to build a mathematical functions plotter using Python, NumPy, SymPy, and Matplotlib.

how-to-run-programs-on-a-mainframe.title: Starting and Running Your First Program on a Mainframe
how-to-run-programs-on-a-mainframe.description: How to run your first program on a mainframe using open source software.

human-systems.title: All Systems are Human Systems
human-systems.description: All systems in the field of software engineering are built by humans, to serve human purposes, and sometimes have broad but subtle influences in society and politics. It's in all of our best interests to to understand the broader, human scope that these systems operate within.

how-to-package-python-for-apt-deb.title: Python Packaging Guide for APT/Debian
how-to-package-python-for-apt-deb.description: A quick guide on how to package your Python/pip project into an apt-installable Debian package using stdeb.

cobol.description: A guide to learning COBOL for the modern programmer.

wireguard.title: Some Unofficial WireGuard Documentation
wireguard.description: Some unofficial documentation for the WireGuard VPN, including config API reference, tutorials, examples, and projects. (This is a mirror of the original on Github)

5-paquetes-django.title: Cinco Paquetes de Django Que Amamos en Monadical
5-paquetes-django.description: Uno de los mayores atractivos de Django es su ecosistema. Si se presenta algún problema existen muchas posibilidades de que alguien en la comunidad también lo haya tenido, y fuera tan amable de abstraerlo en un paquete reutilizable y publicarlo para la comunidad. Aquí encontrará cinco paquetes muy útiles que usamos con

django-packages.title: Five Django Packages We Love at Monadical
django-packages.description: One of the biggest draws to Django is its ecosystem. If you encounter a problem, the chances are that someone else in the community has too, and has been kind enough to abstract it into a package and release it. Here are five packages we find ourselves coming back to.

drone-web-platform.title: Drone Web Platform
drone-web-platform.description: A platform for operating drones through the internet.

virtual-classes-in-cython.title: Implementing C++ Virtual Functions in Cython
virtual-classes-in-cython.description: This is an extensive article that assumes Cython knowledge and describes two strategies for using C++ code from Python, requiring the implementation of virtual functions in C++ abstract classes.

oddslingers-open-source.description: The OddSlingers poker platform, built with python/django in the backend, and react/redux in the frontend, is now free and open source.

event-driven-architecture-1.title: Event Diven Architecture part 1
event-driven-architecture-1.description: Lessons learned in building a poker platform using event-driven architecture, part one--the backend.

set-up-ci-workflow-part-three.description: CI/CD Workflow For a Flask App Using GitHub Actions and AWS ECS

why-use-orm.title: Why should you use an ORM (Object Relational Mapper)?
why-use-orm.description: Budding web developers learning Model-View-Controller frameworks are taught that they should use an Object Relational Mapper (ORM) to interface with their databases. But the “why” is often brushed aside or omitted entirely, leaving a fledgling programmer with burning questions like ”What are ORMs, anyway?”

set-up-ci-workflow-part-two.title: How to Set Up a CI/CD Workflow, Part Two
set-up-ci-workflow-part-two.description: In a previous article, I explained how to set up a pipeline to send images from GitHub to AWS ECR. In this article, I will focus on implementing the missing steps required for a fully functional CD pipeline.

drone-mapping.description: An introduction to drone mapping. How to create a terrain surface model using a mobile app, your computer or cloud service, and your own drone.

everyone-should-know-about-docker.description: What is Docker and how does it work? This introduction walks you through the benefits of this core technology and shows you how to get started with it.

set-up-ci-workflow.description: How to set up a basic CI workflow using GitHub and AWS, relying completely on managed services so you don’t increase your maintenance burden.

system-monitoring-tools.title: Unix System Monitoring and Diagnostic CLI Tools
system-monitoring-tools.description: An opinionated list of CLI utilities for monitoring and inspecting Linux/BSD systems.

moving-to-linux-desktop.title: The Year of the Linux Desktop
moving-to-linux-desktop.description: The year of the Linux desktop has arrived. This is a guide for how to improve the Linux desktop experience.

open-source-innovation-technology.title: Why Open Source Projects Are Key to Innovation & Technology
open-source-innovation-technology.description: Find out how open source projects are essential to innovation and the development of new technology.

knowledge-in-box.title: How to Fit All Human Knowledge in a Box
knowledge-in-box.description: How we used the power of Cython to help streamline how knowledge can be packaged and accessed all over the world – even without the internet.

author.title: Monadical COO

principles-handbook.title: Monadical Principles Handbook
principles-handbook.description: Our goal with this document is to share some of our knowledge and expertise around the process of working together as a team, in order to achieve a more efficient, happy and healthy working environment.

how-to-make-remote-work-part-two-zulip.title: How to Make Remote Work: Part Two, Zulip
how-to-make-remote-work-part-two-zulip.description: How I've learned to be productive working from home. I'll write a second guide about how I think about remote work as a manager and the processes Monadical have put into place to make things work for us.

how-to-make-remote-work-part-one.title: How to Make Remote Work: Part One
how-to-make-remote-work-part-one.description: How to build asyncronous processes that enable you to work efficiently with a distributed engineering team.

using-multiple-smtpd-sender-login-maps-i.description: How we tracked down and fixed a bug caused by Postfix’s type:table using the new unionmap feature.

python-performance-profiling.description: Modern techniques for performance profiling & optimization of Python applications.

anatomy-of-html-css-js.title: An Introduction to HTML and CSS Anatomy
anatomy-of-html-css-js.description: A basic introduction and glossary for people learning HTML, CSS, and Javascript. Intended for people just getting started with frontend development.

favorite-blogs.title: Our Favorite Technical Blogs
favorite-blogs.description: A list of our favorite technical blogs by friends, prominent programmers, and other companies we follow.

monadical-study-guide.title: Monadical Applicant Study Guide
monadical-study-guide.description: A list of documentation, resources, and example projects for potential applicants who are thinking about joining Monadical.

avoiding-dry-for-easier-refactoring.title: Easier Refactoring by Avoiding DRY Patterns
avoiding-dry-for-easier-refactoring.description: A short post about a particularly nice pattern for future refactorers that breaks the Don't-Repeat-Yourself principle commonly taught to beginners.

breach-response.title: Security Breach Response Guidelines
breach-response.description: What should you do if your company gets hacked? What are the things to avoid and what are the procedures to follow? We explore the whole process in this post.

declarative-animations.title: Cleaner JS Animation Architecture With Functional Declarative Patterns
declarative-animations.description: As systems get more complex, they trend towards expressing more of their complexity as data. Animations can be defined in data too.

intro-to-opt-directory.title: Server Provisioning and the /opt Directory
intro-to-opt-directory.description: An overview of how we provision and organize code and data on servers using the UNIX /opt directory.

django-operation-queue.title: A Strategy for Linearizing Database Operations
django-operation-queue.description: Everyone wants their writes strictly ordered, if we can represent a list of write operations as a data structure, that gets easier.

company-not-ico.title: We’re Building A Company, Not An ICO
company-not-ico.description: A frank discussion about the benefits and pitfalls of the ICO hype, and why Monadical' vision goes far beyond short-term fundraising.

poker-networks.title: The State of Poker Platforms in 2018
poker-networks.description: An overview of the all the current online Poker networks as of 2018, with pros and cons for each and a summary of features.

atomic.title: Database Integrity Principles for Safe Systems
atomic.description: Design strategies and common pitfalls that come into play when designing a banking service to handle concurrent transactions in a distributed environment.

trustless.title: The Myth of Trustlessness
trustless.description: The word “trustless” implies that trust has been removed from the system altogether. But in reality, systems like Bitcoin require plenty of trust, it's just less obvious.

full-stack-dev-checklist.title: The Full-Stack Developer Checklist
full-stack-dev-checklist.description: A checklist of things for full-stack developers to strive to learn, spanning everything front frontend, to backend, to native development and devops.

redux.title: The Redux Store as the Frontend's Database
redux.description: Storing data in a normalized form allows us to calculate fast indexes for lookups.

segwit.title: An Explanation of Segwit and the Lighning Network
segwit.description: Segwit increases total number of bytes for each transaction (very slightly), but changes the way that block size is calculated so that the signatures don’t count as much against the limit.

reconciling.title: Reconciling Templates and JS Components
reconciling.description: The fundamental issue is that Django wants you to build up your pages using template fragments, and React wants to pull you into its world with JS components as the main building blocks.

concurrent.title: Two Approaches to Concurrent Write-Safety in Django
concurrent.description: When dealing with Django models accessed by multiple people, you want a way to make sure two requests don’t perform writes at the same time.

reduxsharing.title: Redux State-Sharing Approaches
reduxsharing.description: When writing an app using Redux and React, you may run into the common problem of having to share state between multiple components in your app.

map-of-cs.title: A Map of Computer Science Subfields
map-of-cs.description: A map of all the subfields encompassed by computer science, with job titles commonly used to hire people in those areas.

downswings.title: Downswings and the Information Game
downswings.description: I often hear players say, “I hate that site. It’s completely rigged. I can never win there.” Perhaps those players simply ran bad at first on that site...
